intro: Limodorum bicallosum, commonly known as the two-lobed lily or the lesser purple lily, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and are often clustered in pairs, giving it its common name. Limodorum bicallosum is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in association with other orchid species.
